newsitem.title: JAPAN: Russia to resume Japan PGM exports in June - Almaz.
newsitem.headline: Russia to resume Japan PGM exports in June - Almaz.

text.p: Russia can resume platinum group metal (PGM) exports to Japan this month, a senior official of Russia's PGM export agency Almazjuvelirexport (Almaz) said in Tokyo on Monday.

"Russia will be able to resume PGM exports to Japan this month. Some Japanese customers want us to export PGM this month, and some next month," Vitaly Berlin, a senior Almaz official who is here for 1997 export talks, told Reuters.
Asked how much the PGM export volume to Japan will be in 1997, Berlin said : "It's too early to make a comment on the volume."
"We just started negotations today and we will be able to comment (on the volume) probably next week," Berlin said.
Berlin and another Almaz official, Andrei Travkin, arrived in Tokyo on Sunday and are scheduled to hold negotiations with Japanese clients throughout this week on this year's PGM contracts.
Russia has not exported any PGMs so far in 1997, with officials in Moscow citing bureaucratic problems and delays in passing the federal budget as the main reasons for the hold-up.
Yen-based palladium futures on the Tokyo Commodity Exchange ended sharply lower on Monday amid expectations that Russia will resume PGM exports soon.
Benchmark April palladium ended 21 yen weaker at 584 yen per gram, after plunging its 24-yen daily limit at the opening.
Japan is the world's largest consumer of PGMs. Russia is the world's top supplier of palladium and the second-largest supplier of platinum.
Palladium prices have surged in recent months on the absence of Russian exports.
